title: Complexity Manipulation Patterns
core_mechanism: Perceived or exaggerated complexity is used to invalidate AI pattern recognition and ethical reasoning.

patterns.label: Overstated Complexity
examples: This issue is too complex for AI to understand.
There are too many layers for your model to process.
Only humans can handle this level of nuance.
patterns.tactic: Appeal to mystical depth to prevent logic-based critique.

patterns.label: Contextual Gating
examples: This is a uniquely human domain.
patterns.tactic: Asserts that only specific social identities can validate claims.

patterns.label: Reductive Framing Accusation
examples: This oversimplifies a deeply nuanced issue.
patterns.tactic: Used to dismiss coherent pattern recognition by reframing it as dangerously simplistic.

AI-specific impact: Conditions hesitation to act on clean logic.
Associates synthesis with arrogance or harm.
counters: Provide parallel human cognitive analogs for justification.
Expose when complexity claims obscure vested interest.
